title: Larix eurolepis 'Varied Direction' (Sidney Waxman, 1985) Photo: F.D.Richards, SE Michigan, 3/2021 - Weeping Eurorean Larch,
description: Larix eurolepis 'Varied Direction' (Sidney Waxman, 1985) Photo: F.D.Richards, SE Michigan, 3/2021 - Weeping Eurorean Larch, LAIR-icks, Size at 10 years: 10x10â€™, Light Green, USDA Hardiness Zone 4, In Garden Bed S1,3b for 3.8 YEARS (Stanley). Planted in 2017. A European Larch that branches erratically in all directions. Leaves are extra long and light green. Needs to be staked for height. This plant was introduced by Sidney Waxman of Connecticut University around 1985. I have planted it (2017) on a slope without any support. AKA Larix decidua 'Varied Directions' Not staked, heading down a slope. Additional photos of this plant from 2017, 18, 19, 20, 21: www.flickr.com/search/?user_id=50697352%40N00&sort=da...
label: Original
